Division.LongName: Division of Computing and Communication Foundations

Award.AbstractNarration:
This award provides student travel support for the International Conference on Distributed Computing (DISC) to be held from October 11-15 2014, in Austin, Texas. DISC is one of two premier conferences in the foundations of distributed computing, and is a forum on the theory, design, analysis, implementation, and application of distributed systems and networks.

Distributed systems are becoming increasingly indispensable in our day to day lives. The functioning of basic communication infrastructure and services relies on our understanding and correct implementation of distributed systems. The broader impact is that attendance of students in DISC will expose more students to the exciting developments in the field and in the long run will help to build a broad base of expertise in the field, which will impact both industry and academia.

POR.DRECONTENT:
This project provided financial support for 16 US-based graduate students to travel and attend the "2014 International Symposium on Distributed Computing", or "DISC-2014" for short. DISC-2014 was held in Austin, Texas between the 12th and 15th of October 2014. When this spport was provided, the supported graduate students were enrolled in departments of computer science at seven universities in the US. These seven universities are (1) California Institute of Technology, (2) University of Texas at Dallas, (3) Stony Brook University, (4) University of New Mexico, (5) Arizona State University, (6) Brown University, and (7) University of Texas at Austin. Attending DISC-2014 provided the supported graduate students with valuable training and helped in prmoting their professional and academic careers.

This project also provided financial support for one PhD student in the department of computer science at the University of Texas at Austin to travel to Singapore and present his paper, titled "A Secure Credit Card Protocol Over NFC", at the "2016 International Conference on Distributed Computing and Networking", or "ICDCN-2016" for short. ICDCN-2016 was held in Singapore between the 4th and 7th of January 2016. Attending ICDCN-2016 provided the PhD student with valuable training and helped in promoting his professional and academic career.
